Talk_0097:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>To me, the Unity Bell is just a useful
landmark for my strolls around town.

But I've heard folks come in from out
of town just to see it.

The bell's become quite famous since
<clr:0000>President Hudson<clr:ffff> had his wedding there.
Talk_0063:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>Oh, Mattison! <sp:5:0:0>There you are.<sp:5:0:0> You've
gotten so big.
Talk_0098:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I hope when Mattison grows up, she'll
want to have her wedding here. Just like
her parents.
Talk_0064:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's not her, darling.<sp:0:4:0>Didn't Mattison say she was <clr:0000>going
back home<clr:ffff>?
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Oh my! <sp:5:0:0>Do you need something in
my house?<sp:0:4:0>I don't have much to offer, but make
yourself at home.
Talk_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Oh my! <sp:5:0:0>You again?<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Ease_01>I suppose if you're so comfortable here,
you might as well make yourself at home.
Talk_0067:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>Why wouldn't we be? You're still a young
woman, dear.
Talk_0069:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I hope Mattison will be all right on
the railcar.<sp:0:4:0>It's been harder to use ever since Hagie
became the manager.
Talk_0080:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>I'm so pleased Mattison was able to board
the railcar to see President Hudson.<sp:0:4:0>I wonder if the manager turned a blind
eye for her this time.
Talk_0081:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ever since Mattison moved, even the
Goddess Statue seems lonely.

I hope someday when Mattison's all grown
up, she has her wedding ceremony here,
just like her parents.
Talk_0083:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I heard the <clr:0000>president <clr:ffff>is in the office at
the moment. That doesn't happen often
these days.
Talk_0084:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I told you, darling, that's not her.<sp:0:4:0>Mattison is probably <clr:0000>back at home<clr:ffff>
by now.
Talk_0085:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hm... <sp:5:0:0>But if the manager doesn't see her,
he won't be able to stop her.
Talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Thanks to<clr:0000> Hudson<clr:ffff>, <clr:0000>Tarrey Town <clr:ffff>has
grown rather famous.
Talk_0086:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>By the way, <sp:5:0:0>where was Mattison going on
the railcar?
Talk_0052: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Hmm. <sp:5:0:0>Where has that girl gone off to?
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>I need to sleep soon. I've got an early day
again tomorrow, after all.
Talk_0053:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>I'm so pleased Mattison was able to board
the railcar to see Hudson.<sp:0:4:0>I wonder if the manager turned a blind
eye for her this time.
Talk_0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>With a blind eye, it couldn't have been
hard for her to sneak by, after all.
Talk_0056:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We were talking about how Hudson
and Rhondson had their wedding
ceremony here.
I do hope we're still around to see
Mattison's wedding ceremony.
Talk_0057:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>Hudson<clr:ffff>, darling, not "Mudson."


You shouldn't forget a <clr:0000>founder of
Tarrey Town<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0100:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Are you here to see Tarrey Town's Unity
Bell? You know, there's a Goddess Statue
in the area as well.
<clr:0000>Hudson<clr:ffff> even had his wedding at the bell.
Talk_0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff> has grown quite popular,
after all.
Talk_0059:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>Ah, Mattison.<sp:5:0:0> ...Oh? <sp:5:0:0> What broad
shoulders you have nowadays.
Talk_0071:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well, he charges a <clr:0000>fee<clr:ffff> to use it now,
doesn't he, darling?

Paying for a ride would be a problem for a
child, after all.
Talk_0103:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>Speaking of Hudson, it seems his
daughter, Mattison,<sp:5:0:0> was able to board
the railcar.
I wonder if the manager turned a blind
eye for her this time.
Talk_0073:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>She went to help Hudson. She's such a
sweet vai for one so young.
Talk_0074:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh my, another traveler?<sp:0:4:0><clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff> has grown quite popular,
after all.

All of that is thanks to <clr:0000>President Hudson<clr:ffff>.


I'm so very grateful.
Talk_0075:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>I hope someday when Mattison grows up,
she has her wedding ceremony here, just
like her parents.
Talk_0076:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm talking about the president of <clr:0000>Hudson
Construction<clr:ffff>. He helped build this town.
Talk_0077:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm friends with Hudson's whole family.


I'm especially fond of their only daughter,
Mattison. What a dear.
Talk_0043:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>He's the president of <clr:0000>Hudson
Construction<clr:ffff>, who built this town.
Talk_0078:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Tarrey Town has grown popular indeed if
visitors are coming at this hour.

Are you here to see the Unity Bell?


It's become quite famous since <clr:0000>President
Hudson<clr:ffff> hosted his wedding there.

As for me, the bell marks the perfect
distance for my little strolls.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>The fountain always brings me peace,
even if I'm just passing by.
Talk_0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>Over there, darling.


It's the place with the sign you always
mistake for <clr:0000>Hudson<clr:ffff> and say hello to.
Talk_0090: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Oh dear. Traveling in the rain, I see.
Talk_0079:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Still, I hope Mattison will be all right.


The railcar has been harder to use
ever since Hagie became the manager.
Talk_0045:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Eh? Didn't they open an office
around here?
Talk_0091:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>See that cutout? That's Hudson. Not the
real Hudson, of course.

But my husband can't always tell, and
sometimes he'll greet the sign like it's
the man himself.
Talk_0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sorry about that.


My husband has been getting more
forgetful lately.

Never mind us. Please enjoy your visit.
Talk_0093:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Have you seen that person-shaped
cutout, hm?

That's a painting of Hudson, sure enough.


It's such a fine likeness that my husband
has a habit of greeting the sign.
Talk_0094:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease>My husband isn't the only one who has
trouble remembering things. Age isn't
kind to memory.
I need to learn from Mattison's example
and write down important things in
a <clr:0000>notebook<clr:ffff>.
It's awfully sad to think that I only have
a little longer to play with Mattison.
Talk_0095:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It won't do to chit-chat in the rain. Why
don't we continue this under a roof?
Talk_0060:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I wonder if Mattison will be able to board
the railcar. Hopefully the manager
won't stop her.
